content:
DispatcherHooks Class

Definition

Provides additional event information about Dispatcher processing.

In this Article

public sealed class DispatcherHooks
Inheritance
System.Object
DispatcherHooks

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Events

DispatcherInactive

Occurs when the dispatcher has no more operations to process.

public event EventHandler DispatcherInactive;

Remarks

This event is raised by the dispatcher thread when there are no more pending work items.

OperationAborted

Occurs when an operation is aborted.

public event System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherHookEventHandler OperationAborted;

Remarks

Any thread can abort an operation; therefore, this event can be raised by any thread.

OperationCompleted

Occurs when an operation completes.

public event System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherHookEventHandler OperationCompleted;

Remarks

This event is raised by the dispatcher thread after the operation has completed.

OperationPosted

Occurs when an operation is posted to the dispatcher.

public event System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherHookEventHandler OperationPosted;

Remarks

Typically, this event occurs during a call to BeginInvoke.

This event can occur during a call to Invoke if any priority other than DispatcherPriority is specified, or if the destination dispatcher is owned by a different thread.

Any thread can post operations; therefore, this event can be raised by any thread.

OperationPriorityChanged

Occurs when the priority of an operation is changed.

public event System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherHookEventHandler OperationPriorityChanged;

Remarks

Any thread can change the priority of operations; therefore, this event can be raised by any thread.

OperationStarted

Occurs when an operation is invoked.

public event System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherHookEventHandler OperationStarted;
